ovs.routes package¶

Submodules¶

ovs.routes.admin_routes module¶

routes under /admin/

ovs.routes.admin_routes.register_manager()[source]¶

/admin/register_manager serves an html form with input fields for email, first name, last name, and role and accepts that form (POST) and adds a user to the user table with a default password.

ovs.routes.auth_routes module¶

routes under /auth/

ovs.routes.auth_routes.login()[source]¶

Interface for users to login

ovs.routes.auth_routes.logout()[source]¶

Logs a user out

ovs.routes.dev_routes module¶

Routes for developers

ovs.routes.dev_routes.dev_home_page()[source]¶

A home page that displays links to all accessible routes

ovs.routes.dev_routes.has_no_empty_params(rule)[source]¶

Checks if the rule is valid for navigation

ovs.routes.manager_routes module¶

Routes under /manager/

ovs.routes.manager_routes.add_meals()[source]¶

/manager/meal_login serves an html form with input field pin and accepts that form (POST) and logs the use to a meal plan

ovs.routes.manager_routes.create_meal_plan()[source]¶

/manager/meal_login serves an html form with input field pin and accepts that form (POST) and logs the use to a meal plan

ovs.routes.manager_routes.landing_page()[source]¶

The landing page for managers

ovs.routes.manager_routes.manage_packages()[source]¶

/manager/register_resident serves an html form with input fields for email, first name, and last name and accepts that form (POST) and adds a user to the user table with a default password.

ovs.routes.manager_routes.manage_residents()[source]¶

/manager/manage_residents serves a HTML with list of residents with their info. It allows a manager to add/edit/delete residents with form inputs.

ovs.routes.manager_routes.meal_login()[source]¶

/manager/meal_login serves an html form with input field pin and accepts that form (POST) and logs the use to a meal plan

ovs.routes.manager_routes.meal_undo()[source]¶

/manager/meal_undo accepts that form (POST) and undo the use of a meal plan Currently uses manager id to distinguish frontends. Should use session token.

ovs.routes.manager_routes.register_room()[source]¶

/manager/register_room serves an HTML form with input fields for room #, status, and type and accepts that form (POST) and adds a room to the rooms table. The option for admins to add current residents to said room is an available option.

ovs.routes.ovs_routes module¶

Routes under /

ovs.routes.ovs_routes.landing_page()[source]¶

The homepage for OVS

ovs.routes.resident_routes module¶

under /resident

ovs.routes.resident_routes.edit_profile()[source]¶

Allows the user to edit their profile in a wtform

ovs.routes.resident_routes.landing_page()[source]¶

The landing page for residents
